channel.title: SD Ruby Podcast
channel.description: Watch awesome talks on Ruby, Ruby on Rails, and other topics in this long-running video podcast from the San Diego Ruby user group. This podcast features live talks from SD Ruby members which are recorded each month on the campus of the University of California San Diego, in the Computer Science and Engineering building. The SD Ruby podcast is sponsored by New Relic. Bandwidth is provided by Joyent.
channel.itunes:author: SD Ruby

item.title: Episode 133: Introduction to Watir
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Hillary Hueter demonstrates how to validate user interfaces with Watir. Learn how to write scripts that automate common functions (clicking links, selecting options from a list, filling out forms, etc.) and how to use Watir in Cucumber or RSpec tests.
item.description: Hillary Hueter demonstrates how to validate user interfaces with Watir. Learn how to write scripts that automate common functions (clicking links, selecting options from a list, filling out forms, etc.) and how to use Watir in Cucumber or RSpec tests.

item.title: Episode 132: Intro to Ruby 2.0
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Matt Aimonetti introduces the latest version of Ruby -- Ruby 2.0. Find out what's new in Ruby and what it means for your Rails applications.
item.description: Matt Aimonetti introduces the latest version of Ruby -- Ruby 2.0. Find out what's new in Ruby and what it means for your Rails applications.

item.title: Episode 131: Profiling Ruby
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Greg Price was frustrated by how long it takes Ruby 1.9.3 apps to launch, so he decided to dive in and fix things. By using general techniques for profiling and fixing code, he was able to make app launching in Ruby 2.0 twice as fast. Greg shares his techniques and shows how they can be used for any performance problem in MRI or a C extension.
item.description: Greg Price was frustrated by how long it takes Ruby 1.9.3 apps to launch, so he decided to dive in and fix things. By using general techniques for profiling and fixing code, he was able to make app launching in Ruby 2.0 twice as fast. Greg shares his techniques and shows how they can be used for any performance problem in MRI or a C extension.

item.title: Episode 130: What's New in Rails 4
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Ruby on Rails 4 offers a number of useful new features and also breaks ties with a lot of old Rails baggage. Ben Hughes talks about what's new in the next release of Rails and shows how to prepare your existing Rails 3 apps for the upgrade.
item.description: Ruby on Rails 4 offers a number of useful new features and also breaks ties with a lot of old Rails baggage. Ben Hughes talks about what's new in the next release of Rails and shows how to prepare your existing Rails 3 apps for the upgrade.

item.title: Episode 129: Class's Class is Class (Metaprogramming is Trolling You)
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Chris Kelly returns to SD Ruby to give a talk on Ruby metaprogramming, starting with the Ruby Object Model and working through the most common metaprogramming callbacks.
item.description: Chris Kelly returns to SD Ruby to give a talk on Ruby metaprogramming, starting with the Ruby Object Model and working through the most common metaprogramming callbacks.

item.title: Episode 128: Writing APIs
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: James Miller explores writing and testing JSON APIs with Sinatra and rack/test. Authenticate, handle errors, set proper HTTP status codes, customize headers with pagination and rate limiting data, and mount it to an existing Rails app.
item.description: James Miller explores writing and testing JSON APIs with Sinatra and rack/test. Authenticate, handle errors, set proper HTTP status codes, customize headers with pagination and rate limiting data, and mount it to an existing Rails app.

item.title: Episode 127: Saying No to NoSQL
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan Neddenriep shows how to migrate a production application from MongoDB to Postgres without losing your mind or your data.
item.description: Jonathan Neddenriep shows how to migrate a production application from MongoDB to Postgres without losing your mind or your data.

item.title: Episode 126: Fast
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: We live in a fast society, so why should our apps be any different? Richard Schneeman from Heroku demonstrates how to optimize your Rails app for speed and scalability -- on both the front end and back end. If you wanna go fast, this talk is for you.
item.description: We live in a fast society, so why should our apps be any different? Richard Schneeman from Heroku demonstrates how to optimize your Rails app for speed and scalability -- on both the front end and back end. If you wanna go fast, this talk is for you.

item.title: Episode 125: Get Concurrent With Puma
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Matt Aimonetti shows how to serve up web pages using Puma, a multithreaded, easy-to-use Ruby web server. Based on Mongrel, Puma is a small library built with Rack that provides a very fast and concurrent HTTP 1.1 server for Ruby web applications.
item.description: Matt Aimonetti shows how to serve up web pages using Puma, a multithreaded, easy-to-use Ruby web server. Based on Mongrel, Puma is a small library built with Rack that provides a very fast and concurrent HTTP 1.1 server for Ruby web applications.

item.title: Episode 124: Build Your Api With Node.js
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Scott Motte demonstrates how to build an API for your next web application using the power of Node.js.
item.description: Scott Motte demonstrates how to build an API for your next web application using the power of Node.js.

item.title: Episode 123: A Tour of Haskell: A Rubyist's Take on Functional Programming
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Xavier Lange discusses features and concepts of Haskell. Haskell is a high-level, strictly-typed, and lazy functional programming language. This talk is geared towards Ruby developers who want to stretch their programming muscles.
item.description: Xavier Lange discusses features and concepts of Haskell. Haskell is a high-level, strictly-typed, and lazy functional programming language. This talk is geared towards Ruby developers who want to stretch their programming muscles.

item.title: Episode 122: RubyMotion: Native iOS Apps in Ruby
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Learn how to get started with RubyMotion, a new tool that lets you quickly develop and test native iOS applications for iPhone or iPad using Ruby. James Miller demonstrates how to create a project, configure it, manage dependencies, and get your idea into the App Store.
item.description: Learn how to get started with RubyMotion, a new tool that lets you quickly develop and test native iOS applications for iPhone or iPad using Ruby. James Miller demonstrates how to create a project, configure it, manage dependencies, and get your idea into the App Store.

item.title: Episode 121: How to Make Your Rails App Roar With the Power of Lion
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: OS X Lion might be the world's most advanced OS, but we don't normally use it to host Rails applications. It can be pricey, hard to virtualize, and doesn't work well with Linux-based servers. Patrick Crowley demonstrates a breakthrough way to integrate OS X services into your app.
item.description: OS X Lion might be the world's most advanced OS, but we don't normally use it to host Rails applications. It can be pricey, hard to virtualize, and doesn't work well with Linux-based servers. Patrick Crowley demonstrates a breakthrough way to integrate OS X services into your app.

item.title: Episode 120: Postgres FTW: Postgres Is Just Easier
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Why choose Postgres over the "other" open source database? Guyren Howe has the answer. He will demonstrate how Postgres can make building database applications easier -- including custom data types, custom functions, robust text search, and more.
item.description: Why choose Postgres over the "other" open source database? Guyren Howe has the answer. He will demonstrate how Postgres can make building database applications easier -- including custom data types, custom functions, robust text search, and more.

item.title: Episode 119: Postgres Rules
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Postgres has a powerful feature called rules that let you rewrite incoming queries. Rules are similar to triggers in Postgres, but much more efficient. Guyren Howe shows how to use rules in some common use cases.
item.description: Postgres has a powerful feature called rules that let you rewrite incoming queries. Rules are similar to triggers in Postgres, but much more efficient. Guyren Howe shows how to use rules in some common use cases.

item.title: Episode 118: Smaller Javascript Packages With the Rails Asset Pipeline
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Marc Leglise shows how to break up your large application.js into logical chunks, leveraging more power from the Rails 3 asset pipeline. Building on last month's talk by Rafael Cardoso, this method allows you to separate concerns about download sizes from triggers for page-specific javascript.
item.description: Marc Leglise shows how to break up your large application.js into logical chunks, leveraging more power from the Rails 3 asset pipeline. Building on last month's talk by Rafael Cardoso, this method allows you to separate concerns about download sizes from triggers for page-specific javascript.

item.title: Episode 117: Command Line Applications in Ruby: the Good Stuff
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Mark Ranallo explores writing command line applications for the Unix programming environment, including a basic overview, some tips/tricks, and Ruby gems that can help.
item.description: Mark Ranallo explores writing command line applications for the Unix programming environment, including a basic overview, some tips/tricks, and Ruby gems that can help.

item.title: Episode 116: Javascript Isolation With the Rails Asset Pipeline
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Rafael Cardoso shows how to load page specific javascript, while still using the default configuration for the asset pipeline in Rails 3.
item.description: Rafael Cardoso shows how to load page specific javascript, while still using the default configuration for the asset pipeline in Rails 3.

item.title: Episode 115: You're a Manager. Now What?
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: It happens to a lot of us: you're doing a good job as an engineer, you've been around the company for a while, and BAM! You get "promoted". Well, it turns out that like engineering, management takes skill and practice. You can't just expect that because you're smart you'll be good at it. Nic Benders from New Relic talks about what some of those skills are, and how to work on improving them.
item.description: It happens to a lot of us: you're doing a good job as an engineer, you've been around the company for a while, and BAM! You get "promoted". Well, it turns out that like engineering, management takes skill and practice. You can't just expect that because you're smart you'll be good at it. Nic Benders from New Relic talks about what some of those skills are, and how to work on improving them.

item.title: Episode 114: The Global Interpeter Lock in Ruby, Python, and Javascript
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Have you heard of the infamous Global Interpreter Lock that prevents Ruby from being webscale? Are you so scared you might switch to Node.js? Well, before you do, learn more about what the GIL is, what it does, and why it isn't being removed. Matt Aimonetti explains.
item.description: Have you heard of the infamous Global Interpreter Lock that prevents Ruby from being webscale? Are you so scared you might switch to Node.js? Well, before you do, learn more about what the GIL is, what it does, and why it isn't being removed. Matt Aimonetti explains.

item.title: Episode 113: Visualize Twitter #tags in Real Time
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Etienne de Bruin demonstrates how to visualize Twitter retweets in real time using the tweetstream gem, arbor.js, Redis, and Resque. He also shares his personal journey as a developer and how he came to love Ruby.
item.description: Etienne de Bruin demonstrates how to visualize Twitter retweets in real time using the tweetstream gem, arbor.js, Redis, and Resque. He also shares his personal journey as a developer and how he came to love Ruby.

item.title: Episode 112: Ultra-Minimalist Gem Bootstrapping
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: The simplest way to start a gem from scratch is using nothing but your bare hands. And Bundler. Ian Young shows us how.
item.description: The simplest way to start a gem from scratch is using nothing but your bare hands. And Bundler. Ian Young shows us how.

item.title: Episode 111: Ruby Debugging: Life After "Puts"
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Have you outgrown basic debugging in Ruby? Rob Kaufman shows how to step up your game and use the Ruby debugger in a variety of practical ways.
item.description: Have you outgrown basic debugging in Ruby? Rob Kaufman shows how to step up your game and use the Ruby debugger in a variety of practical ways.

item.title: Episode 110: Converting Flat Data into Rich Ruby Objects with :composed_of
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Storing simple data as model attributes in a database is easy to do in Rails, but sometimes we want to handle and manipulate data that is more than just a string or a number.The :composed_of macro in ActiveRecord gives us that ability, and it's simpler than you think. Chris McCann shows us how.
item.description: Storing simple data as model attributes in a database is easy to do in Rails, but sometimes we want to handle and manipulate data that is more than just a string or a number.The :composed_of macro in ActiveRecord gives us that ability, and it's simpler than you think. Chris McCann shows us how.

item.title: Episode 109: Transforming Ruby Code
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Programmatically transforming Ruby code is easier than you think and has several interesting applications: automated refactoring, coding style/best practices enforcement, DSL translation, and more. Ben Hughes explores how to transform ruby code with available tools.
item.description: Programmatically transforming Ruby code is easier than you think and has several interesting applications: automated refactoring, coding style/best practices enforcement, DSL translation, and more. Ben Hughes explores how to transform ruby code with available tools.

item.title: Episode 108: Fog: The Ruby Cloud Services Library
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: James Miller demonstrates how to get up and running with Fog, including practical use cases, caveats, and how to make Fog better by contributing back.
item.description: James Miller demonstrates how to get up and running with Fog, including practical use cases, caveats, and how to make Fog better by contributing back.

item.title: Episode 107: Advanced Heroku with the Celadon Cedar Stack
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Ryan Daigle and Blake Gentry explore all the new features in Heroku's Celadon Cedar stack.
item.description: Ryan Daigle and Blake Gentry explore all the new features in Heroku's Celadon Cedar stack.

item.title: Episode 106: JRuby: Ruby in the JVM. Why on Earth?!?
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: JRuby is a 100% pure-Java implementation of Ruby with high performance, real threading, and a vast array of libraries. Chris McCann explores how JRuby can provide real value for Rails developers.
item.description: JRuby is a 100% pure-Java implementation of Ruby with high performance, real threading, and a vast array of libraries. Chris McCann explores how JRuby can provide real value for Rails developers.

item.title: Episode 105: Get Your Flow On: Mastering Your Development Workflow
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Rob Kaufman explores tools and options for improving your development process: common issues with managing tasks, starting work, committing branches, and getting completed tasks verified and deployed to production. It's all about automating the little steps because details are too easy to forget.
item.description: Rob Kaufman explores tools and options for improving your development process: common issues with managing tasks, starting work, committing branches, and getting completed tasks verified and deployed to production. It's all about automating the little steps because details are too easy to forget.

item.title: Episode 104: Send SMS Messages and Make Phone Calls From Your App With Twilio
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Brian Levine shows how easy it is to add phone services to your application using Twilio. Twilio wraps powerful telecom infrastructure with a simple REST API and offers pay-as-you-go pricing with cloud scalability.
item.description: Brian Levine shows how easy it is to add phone services to your application using Twilio. Twilio wraps powerful telecom infrastructure with a simple REST API and offers pay-as-you-go pricing with cloud scalability.

item.title: Episode 103: HTML5 Quick Start with Compass-html5-boilerplate
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Peter Gumeson shows off his compass-html5-boilerplate gem, which uses Compass to make it easier to integrate the HTML5 Boilerplate template into Rails apps.
item.description: Peter Gumeson shows off his compass-html5-boilerplate gem, which uses Compass to make it easier to integrate the HTML5 Boilerplate template into Rails apps.

item.title: Episode 102: Newick-Ruby: A Gem for Manipulating Newick Format Trees
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan Badger explores Newick format trees, and how to manipulate them using his Newick-ruby gem.
item.description: Jonathan Badger explores Newick format trees, and how to manipulate them using his Newick-ruby gem.

item.title: Episode 101: TRegexp: Friendly Regular Expressions
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Ian Young introduces his first gem, a human-friendly DSL for regular expressions.
item.description: Ian Young introduces his first gem, a human-friendly DSL for regular expressions.

item.title: Episode 100: Getting Oriented with Compass
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley shows how to turbo-charge your layouts with Compass, a lightweight stylesheet framework built on top of Haml and Sass.
item.description: Patrick Crowley shows how to turbo-charge your layouts with Compass, a lightweight stylesheet framework built on top of Haml and Sass.

item.title: Episode 099: Omniauth: Future Proof Your Authentication
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Kevin Ball shows how the traditional model of username/password authentication is dying, and how Omniauth makes it all rainbows and sunshine going forward.
item.description: Kevin Ball shows how the traditional model of username/password authentication is dying, and how Omniauth makes it all rainbows and sunshine going forward.

item.title: Episode 098: Give Yourself Some Backbone
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Ryan Weald gives a brief overview of Backbone.js and the advantages it has for your project.
item.description: Ryan Weald gives a brief overview of Backbone.js and the advantages it has for your project.

item.title: Episode 097: Basic Reporting with Ruby and CouchDB
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Christopher Petersen shows how to create both basic reports on individual user behavior and aggregate reports across all user activity.
item.description: Christopher Petersen shows how to create both basic reports on individual user behavior and aggregate reports across all user activity.

item.title: Episode 096: Rounded Corners Everywhere
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Scott Olmsted explores Javascript libraries to simulate CSS3 decorations on browsers that don't support them. (Yeah, we're talking about you Internet Explorer.)
item.description: Scott Olmsted explores Javascript libraries to simulate CSS3 decorations on browsers that don't support them. (Yeah, we're talking about you Internet Explorer.)

item.title: Episode 095: The State of MacRuby
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Matt Aimonetti discusses the latest developments with the MacRuby project, which aims to implement Ruby 1.9 directly on top of Mac OS X core technologies.
item.description: Matt Aimonetti discusses the latest developments with the MacRuby project, which aims to implement Ruby 1.9 directly on top of Mac OS X core technologies.

item.title: Episode 094: Refactoring ActiveRecord Models
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: It's always important to keep your ActiveRecord models in tip-top shape. Ben Hughes explores several techniques for refactoring models and preventing them from getting out of hand.
item.description: It's always important to keep your ActiveRecord models in tip-top shape. Ben Hughes explores several techniques for refactoring models and preventing them from getting out of hand.

item.title: Episode 093: Are You Redis?
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Emanuele Tozzato gives a brief introduction to Redis, then demonstrates real-life database performance optimization with redis-object and how to manage background jobs using Resque.
item.description: Emanuele Tozzato gives a brief introduction to Redis, then demonstrates real-life database performance optimization with redis-object and how to manage background jobs using Resque.

item.title: Episode 092: File Uploads With S3SwfUpload
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Nathan Colgate Clark gives a general overview of his Amazon S3 upload plugin (past, present, and future) and shares his thoughts on how it managed to stand out on GitHub.
item.description: Nathan Colgate Clark gives a general overview of his Amazon S3 upload plugin (past, present, and future) and shares his thoughts on how it managed to stand out on GitHub.

item.title: Episode 091: Message Block
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Ben Hughes shows off message_block, a gem which simplifies generating flash and error messages. Additionally, Ben discusses how to test gem development using Cucumber and Cukigem.
item.description: Ben Hughes shows off message_block, a gem which simplifies generating flash and error messages. Additionally, Ben discusses how to test gem development using Cucumber and Cukigem.

item.title: Episode 090: CoffeeScript
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: People are drawn to Ruby by its beautiful syntax, and CoffeeScript brings that same joie de vivre to Javascript. John Lynch shares his experience using CoffeeScript for both web and mobile app development.
item.description: People are drawn to Ruby by its beautiful syntax, and CoffeeScript brings that same joie de vivre to Javascript. John Lynch shares his experience using CoffeeScript for both web and mobile app development.

item.title: Episode 089: Ruleby
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Chris McCann demonstrates Ruleby, a Ruby implementation of a rules engine based on the Rete algorithm.
item.description: Chris McCann demonstrates Ruleby, a Ruby implementation of a rules engine based on the Rete algorithm.

item.title: Episode 088: Trucker
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley talks about Trucker, a new gem that makes it easier to migrate legacy data into Rails apps.
item.description: Patrick Crowley talks about Trucker, a new gem that makes it easier to migrate legacy data into Rails apps.

item.title: Episode 087: Searching With Solr
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Get up and running in no time with enterprise-grade search powered by Solr. Nick Zadrozny shows you what Solr can do, how it works, and how you can make the most of it in production.
item.description: Get up and running in no time with enterprise-grade search powered by Solr. Nick Zadrozny shows you what Solr can do, how it works, and how you can make the most of it in production.

item.title: Episode 086: Mobile Web Apps Using jQTouch
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley dives into the world of mobile app development and shows how to use the jQTouch framework to quickly build awesome mobile-optimized web apps.
item.description: Patrick Crowley dives into the world of mobile app development and shows how to use the jQTouch framework to quickly build awesome mobile-optimized web apps.

item.title: Episode 085: Introduction to Node.js
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Web standards advocate Edward O'Connor gives a quick introduction to Node.js, a new event-driven networking engine for JavaScript.
item.description: Web standards advocate Edward O'Connor gives a quick introduction to Node.js, a new event-driven networking engine for JavaScript.

item.title: Episode 084: Quick and Cheap Usability for Programmers
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Megan O'Rorke introduces the general concept and goal of usability, and shares some quick and cheap usability resources for Ruby developers.
item.description: Megan O'Rorke introduces the general concept and goal of usability, and shares some quick and cheap usability resources for Ruby developers.

item.title: Episode 083: Testing Philosophies
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Rob Kaufman discusses common testing philosophies and methodologies in use by the Ruby community.
item.description: Rob Kaufman discusses common testing philosophies and methodologies in use by the Ruby community.

item.title: Episode 082: Behavior Driven Development Using Ruby, Cucumber, and rSpec
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Steve Ross gives an introduction to behavior driven development using Ruby, Cucumber, and rSpec. This is a practical how-to for developers who have not yet integrated behavior driven development into their workflow.
item.description: Steve Ross gives an introduction to behavior driven development using Ruby, Cucumber, and rSpec. This is a practical how-to for developers who have not yet integrated behavior driven development into their workflow.

item.title: Episode 081: Rolling with Riak
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: John Lynch from Rigel Group gives an overview of Riak, the newest kid on the NoSQL block, and explains why it should power your next web-scale app.
item.description: John Lynch from Rigel Group gives an overview of Riak, the newest kid on the NoSQL block, and explains why it should power your next web-scale app.

item.title: Episode 080: EventMachine, AMQP, and WebSockets: The Musical
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Dan Simpson and Nick Zadrozny give an overview of cutting-edge, real-time programming for the web; and demonstrate an interactive, web-based sequencer.
item.description: Dan Simpson and Nick Zadrozny give an overview of cutting-edge, real-time programming for the web; and demonstrate an interactive, web-based sequencer.

item.title: Episode 079: Artificial Stupidity: Adding Smarts to Yer Kode
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Machine learning and data mining have long been "black arts" because they require access to expensive computing clusters. Randall Thomas discusses machine learning and the problem spaces it can help solve.
item.description: Machine learning and data mining have long been "black arts" because they require access to expensive computing clusters. Randall Thomas discusses machine learning and the problem spaces it can help solve.

item.title: Episode 078: Scripting Android With Ruby
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Mark Ranallo will give an introduction to using JRuby in conjunction with the Android Scripting Environment.
item.description: Mark Ranallo will give an introduction to using JRuby in conjunction with the Android Scripting Environment.

item.title: Episode 077: Building Your Own Hosting Environment
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Nic Benders will show you what's needed for building a hosting environment for production applications. The focus will be on selecting server hardware, picking a Linux Distro, and getting your Rails app running.
item.description: Nic Benders will show you what's needed for building a hosting environment for production applications. The focus will be on selecting server hardware, picking a Linux Distro, and getting your Rails app running.

item.title: Episode 076: OpenCyc
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Guyren Howe gives a way-too-brief demonstration of OpenCyc, an AI technology based on the world's most comprehensive general-purpose ontology. Along the way, he reveals how to talk to OpenCyc using JRuby.
item.description: Guyren Howe gives a way-too-brief demonstration of OpenCyc, an AI technology based on the world's most comprehensive general-purpose ontology. Along the way, he reveals how to talk to OpenCyc using JRuby.

item.title: Episode 075: Heroku
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Blake Mizerany from Heroku shows off the company's cloud platform for Ruby applications. The talk covers Heroku basics, Sinatra, Ruby development, and scaling.
item.description: Blake Mizerany from Heroku shows off the company's cloud platform for Ruby applications. The talk covers Heroku basics, Sinatra, Ruby development, and scaling.

item.title: Episode 074: Moonshine: 190 Proof Deployment
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Jarin Udom shows how to set up a full Rails stack and deploy your app on a bare Ubuntu server in 10 minutes. Is he drunk? Find out!
item.description: Jarin Udom shows how to set up a full Rails stack and deploy your app on a bare Ubuntu server in 10 minutes. Is he drunk? Find out!

item.title: Episode 073: Cappuccino
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary:
Cappuccino is a framework for building desktop-caliber applications that run in a web browser. Brian Chapados reviews the design concepts of Cappuccino and the underlying Objective-J language, shows how to get started, and builds a simple app for searching scientific literature databases.
This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.
item.description:
Cappuccino is a framework for building desktop-caliber applications that run in a web browser. Brian Chapados reviews the design concepts of Cappuccino and the underlying Objective-J language, shows how to get started, and builds a simple app for searching scientific literature databases.

This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.

item.title: Episode 072: MongoDB
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary:
Scott Motte introduces us to the document-oriented database MongoDB and shows how to use MongoDB as an alternative to MySQL and ActiveRecord using the MongoMapper gem.
This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.
item.description:
Scott Motte introduces us to the document-oriented database MongoDB and shows how to use MongoDB as an alternative to MySQL and ActiveRecord using the MongoMapper gem.

This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.

item.title: Episode 071: Mess of Protocols
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary:
Guyren Howe discusses how we use different applications and protocols to govern how we communicate: with whom, how privately, how immediately, whether through text/video/whatever, and so on. He proposes we decouple these ideas, which would simplify and enrich the ways we communicate.
This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.
item.description:
Guyren Howe discusses how we use different applications and protocols to govern how we communicate: with whom, how privately, how immediately, whether through text/video/whatever, and so on. He proposes we decouple these ideas, which would simplify and enrich the ways we communicate.

This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.

item.title: Episode 070: Processing Real-world HTML
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary:
Edward O'Connor from djangosd gives an overview of html5lib, a major-desktop-browser-compatible HTML parser and tokenizer for both Ruby and Python.
This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.
item.description:
Edward O'Connor from djangosd gives an overview of html5lib, a major-desktop-browser-compatible HTML parser and tokenizer for both Ruby and Python.

This talk was part of the DjangoSD/SD Ruby mashup meeting.

item.title: Episode 069: Rails 3: From Vaporware to Awesomeness in 12 Months
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Yehuda Katz returns to San Diego with a report on the latest developments with the Ruby on Rails web application framework.
item.description: Yehuda Katz returns to San Diego with a report on the latest developments with the Ruby on Rails web application framework.

item.title: Episode 068: Hybrid iPhone Apps with Titanium Mobile
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Scott Motte talks about iPhone development using the Titanium Mobile framework, including how to build a basic app.
item.description: Scott Motte talks about iPhone development using the Titanium Mobile framework, including how to build a basic app.

item.title: Episode 067: Cooking up a Cloud (with Chef & EC2)
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Chef is a young and ambitious Ruby DSL built for easy configuration management. Nick Zadrozny will take a look at the philosophy of configuration management, the basics of Chef, and some recipes to build out a basic Rails server.
item.description: Chef is a young and ambitious Ruby DSL built for easy configuration management. Nick Zadrozny will take a look at the philosophy of configuration management, the basics of Chef, and some recipes to build out a basic Rails server.

item.title: Episode 066: Unit Testing: The Easy Way
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary:
With Rspec and Cucumber, Ruby has brought testing to a whole new level, but tests still require a lot of work.
But things just got better. Llewellyn Falco will show you new patterns and practices to dramatically decrease the amount of effort needed to test.
item.description:
With Rspec and Cucumber, Ruby has brought testing to a whole new level, but tests still require a lot of work.

But things just got better. Llewellyn Falco will show you new patterns and practices to dramatically decrease the amount of effort needed to test.

item.title: Episode 065: HotRuby + jQuery: Ruby in the Browser
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Daniel Moore will demonstrate using the HotRuby VM to execute Ruby code natively in the browser. The demonstration shows how Ruby can call native JS libraries, like jQuery, to perform DOM manipulation.
item.description: Daniel Moore will demonstrate using the HotRuby VM to execute Ruby code natively in the browser. The demonstration shows how Ruby can call native JS libraries, like jQuery, to perform DOM manipulation.

item.title: Episode 064: Ruby 1.9.1
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Bradly Feeley reviews the new features and syntax changes in the latest production ready Ruby release, Ruby 1.9.1.
item.description: Bradly Feeley reviews the new features and syntax changes in the latest production ready Ruby release, Ruby 1.9.1.

item.title: Episode 063: Earning an "A" in YSlow
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Nick Zadrozny takes us on a tour of basic website performance optimization, covering 13 optimizations you shouldn't deploy your site without. He'll also go over some sample implementations for a typical Rails app, including a demo of how to serve your public assets from Amazon's new CloudFront CDN.
item.description: Nick Zadrozny takes us on a tour of basic website performance optimization, covering 13 optimizations you shouldn't deploy your site without. He'll also go over some sample implementations for a typical Rails app, including a demo of how to serve your public assets from Amazon's new CloudFront CDN.

item.title: Episode 062: Track Magic
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Jim Rea will demonstrate Track Magic, a plugin for Panorama that allows Rails developers to interact directly with Rails databases on the desktop without a browser.
item.description: Jim Rea will demonstrate Track Magic, a plugin for Panorama that allows Rails developers to interact directly with Rails databases on the desktop without a browser.

item.title: Episode 061: Tanning Bed
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Rob Kaufman demonstrates Tanning Bed, his new Solr search mixin for any Ruby class. Tanning Bed makes fewer assumptions about how you want to deal with the Solr search engine, while still providing easy Ruby-like interfaces.
item.description: Rob Kaufman demonstrates Tanning Bed, his new Solr search mixin for any Ruby class. Tanning Bed makes fewer assumptions about how you want to deal with the Solr search engine, while still providing easy Ruby-like interfaces.

item.title: Episode 060: Migrating Legacy Data
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary:
Let's face it. Migrating legacy data into a new app is a giant pain in the ass. It's slow, error prone, and a ton of work.
What if you could import old data into a new app before it's finished? Normalize fields? Clean up old data? And migrate often? Patrick Crowley shows the way.
item.description:
Let's face it. Migrating legacy data into a new app is a giant pain in the ass. It's slow, error prone, and a ton of work.

What if you could import old data into a new app before it's finished? Normalize fields? Clean up old data? And migrate often? Patrick Crowley shows the way.

item.title: Episode 059: Rails Case Study
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Guyren Howe is doing something a little different with his current project, trying to make it more user-modifiable and user friendly than your average intraweb application, and removing some of the redundancy in regular Rails code. The current state of the project will be discussed, along with whether the interesting parts should be open sourced.
item.description: Guyren Howe is doing something a little different with his current project, trying to make it more user-modifiable and user friendly than your average intraweb application, and removing some of the redundancy in regular Rails code. The current state of the project will be discussed, along with whether the interesting parts should be open sourced.

item.title: Episode 058: MacRuby: What's the big deal?
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary:
Last year, Apple released MacRuby, an open source Ruby implementation written on top of the Objective-C runtime. Writing native MacOSX applications in Ruby without having to pay the cost of using a bridge is now a reality. This is an important milestone for Ruby, Apple and the Ruby community.
Matt Aimonetti will explain the implementation, show how to build desktop applications with MacRuby and HotCocoa, and discuss why Ruby developers should add this new tool to their utility belt. Matt will also talk about the future of MacRuby.
item.description:
Last year, Apple released MacRuby, an open source Ruby implementation written on top of the Objective-C runtime. Writing native MacOSX applications in Ruby without having to pay the cost of using a bridge is now a reality. This is an important milestone for Ruby, Apple and the Ruby community.

Matt Aimonetti will explain the implementation, show how to build desktop applications with MacRuby and HotCocoa, and discuss why Ruby developers should add this new tool to their utility belt. Matt will also talk about the future of MacRuby.

item.title: Episode 057: Facebooker Plugin
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Michael Madrid discusses Styleact (a Facebook application) and how to develop Facebook apps using Ruby on Rails and the Facebooker plugin.
item.description: Michael Madrid discusses Styleact (a Facebook application) and how to develop Facebook apps using Ruby on Rails and the Facebooker plugin.

item.title: Episode 056: Ruby 1.9 or Bust!
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Rob Kaufman talks about his new Ruby 1.9 or Bust project. The project is dedicated to updating popular Ruby gems to be Ruby 1.9 compatible, and is seeking donations to hire a full-time developer to work on porting gems.
item.description: Rob Kaufman talks about his new Ruby 1.9 or Bust project. The project is dedicated to updating popular Ruby gems to be Ruby 1.9 compatible, and is seeking donations to hire a full-time developer to work on porting gems.

item.title: Episode 055: MySQL, Postgres, and Rails
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Guyren Howe has considerable experience with both MySQL and PostgreSQL. He discusses the myriad technical and other advantages to using PostgreSQL instead of MySQL for, well, pretty much anything.
item.description: Guyren Howe has considerable experience with both MySQL and PostgreSQL. He discusses the myriad technical and other advantages to using PostgreSQL instead of MySQL for, well, pretty much anything.

item.title: Episode 054: Paperclip
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley talks about Paperclip, a lightweight plugin for handling attachments.
item.description: Patrick Crowley talks about Paperclip, a lightweight plugin for handling attachments.

item.title: Episode 053: Ruby Arduino Development (RAD)
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Sensors and servos in hand, JD Barnhart shows off the current state of RAD, the Rails inspired framework bringing convention over configuration and Ruby sensibility to the Arduino Physical computing platform.
item.description: Sensors and servos in hand, JD Barnhart shows off the current state of RAD, the Rails inspired framework bringing convention over configuration and Ruby sensibility to the Arduino Physical computing platform.

item.title: Episode 052: Shadow
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Jordan Fowler reveals his new Shadow plugin that tracks attribute and association changes to ActiveRecord objects, making it easy to create activity feeds for your application.
item.description: Jordan Fowler reveals his new Shadow plugin that tracks attribute and association changes to ActiveRecord objects, making it easy to create activity feeds for your application.

item.title: Episode 051: Archaeopteryx
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Giles Bowkett shows off his mega-cool MIDI scaffolding generator for creating dance music with Ruby.
item.description: Giles Bowkett shows off his mega-cool MIDI scaffolding generator for creating dance music with Ruby.

item.title: Episode 050: One-man Lightning Talk
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Kevin Clark is back again and talking about his latest work: Rubinius, grammar parsing from ruby, kqueue, and massive build systems.
item.description: Kevin Clark is back again and talking about his latest work: Rubinius, grammar parsing from ruby, kqueue, and massive build systems.

item.title: Episode 049: Intro to EC2
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Chris Petersen gives an introduction to working with Amazon EC2, and discusses the advantages and disadvantage to hosting your Ruby applications there.
item.description: Chris Petersen gives an introduction to working with Amazon EC2, and discusses the advantages and disadvantage to hosting your Ruby applications there.

item.title: Episode 048: Ruby for Data Processing
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Brian Chapados talks about using ruby and rake to build a simple workflow to coordinate external processes.
item.description: Brian Chapados talks about using ruby and rake to build a simple workflow to coordinate external processes.

item.title: Episode 047: Lazy Indexing
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Matt Aimonetti shows how to quickly get your database queries to run faster when you are not a DBA and are running out of time.
item.description: Matt Aimonetti shows how to quickly get your database queries to run faster when you are not a DBA and are running out of time.

item.title: Episode 046: RSpec in 15 minutes
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Cliff Rhyne describes in 15 minutes what it takes to get up and running with RSpec.
item.description: Cliff Rhyne describes in 15 minutes what it takes to get up and running with RSpec.

item.title: Episode 045: Merb
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Much like Rails, Merb is a MVC web-framework written in Ruby. In this talk, Jordan Fowler introduces Merb and presents some of the distinctions and tradeoffs between the two frameworks.
item.description: Much like Rails, Merb is a MVC web-framework written in Ruby. In this talk, Jordan Fowler introduces Merb and presents some of the distinctions and tradeoffs between the two frameworks.

item.title: Episode 044: Ext JavaScript Library
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Adam Grant talks about his experiences using Ext, a new Javascript library for creating advanced UI controls (like grids, trees, progress bars, etc).
item.description: Adam Grant talks about his experiences using Ext, a new Javascript library for creating advanced UI controls (like grids, trees, progress bars, etc).

item.title: Episode 043: Facebook API
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: John Bresnik discusses the ruby library for the Facebook API, Facebooker, based on his production experience building Facebook applications. Presentation includes general overview of the Facebook API, Facebooker specifics, as well as code examples.
item.description: John Bresnik discusses the ruby library for the Facebook API, Facebooker, based on his production experience building Facebook applications. Presentation includes general overview of the Facebook API, Facebooker specifics, as well as code examples.

item.title: Episode 042: Deploying Rails on Slicehost
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Jared Kuolt shows how to quickly deploy your Rails application to a Slicehost VPS. This talk covers installing MySQL, Nginx, Rails and Mongrel, as well as deployment using Capistrano.
item.description: Jared Kuolt shows how to quickly deploy your Rails application to a Slicehost VPS. This talk covers installing MySQL, Nginx, Rails and Mongrel, as well as deployment using Capistrano.

item.title: Episode 041: MySQL Clustering
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Rob Kaufman takes on database scaling with MySQL. This talk will walk you through setting up a Master (read write) Slave (read only) MySQL network, as well as a Master Master, or Multi-Master network. The talk will also cover the whys and when of database clustering.
item.description: Rob Kaufman takes on database scaling with MySQL. This talk will walk you through setting up a Master (read write) Slave (read only) MySQL network, as well as a Master Master, or Multi-Master network. The talk will also cover the whys and when of database clustering.

item.title: Episode 040: Unobtrusive Javascript
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Matt Aimonetti lays down the law on best-practice Ajax, using behavior oriented javascript with progressive enhancement.
item.description: Matt Aimonetti lays down the law on best-practice Ajax, using behavior oriented javascript with progressive enhancement.

item.title: Episode 039: ActionMailer in Action
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Rob Kaufman talks about using ActionMailer safely, how to keep out of the spam box and how to test your emails before your customers see them.
item.description: Rob Kaufman talks about using ActionMailer safely, how to keep out of the spam box and how to test your emails before your customers see them.

item.title: Episode 038: Haml and Sass in 15 minutes
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley gets you up to speed on using Haml and Sass. Haml is a drop in replacement for ERB that turns your views into beautiful code poetry. Sass does the same for CSS.
item.description: Patrick Crowley gets you up to speed on using Haml and Sass. Haml is a drop in replacement for ERB that turns your views into beautiful code poetry. Sass does the same for CSS.

item.title: Episode 037: Rails Sexy Charts
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Matt Aimonetti demonstrates how to create awesome, Flash-powered charts by integrating Rails with amCharts.
item.description: Matt Aimonetti demonstrates how to create awesome, Flash-powered charts by integrating Rails with amCharts.

item.title: Episode 036: The Return of Kevin Clark
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Kevin Clark takes a break from Powerset to give a full-throttle talk on using Merb as a JSON-RPC service, god, gem2rpm, and heckle.
item.description: Kevin Clark takes a break from Powerset to give a full-throttle talk on using Merb as a JSON-RPC service, god, gem2rpm, and heckle.

item.title: Episode 035: ActiveRecord Backup & MimetypeFu
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Matt Aimonetti demonstrates his newest plugins: ActiveRecord Backup and MimetypeFu.
item.description: Matt Aimonetti demonstrates his newest plugins: ActiveRecord Backup and MimetypeFu.

item.title: Episode 034: Intro to JRuby
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Brian Chapados shows how to install and work with the latest JRuby release.
item.description: Brian Chapados shows how to install and work with the latest JRuby release.

item.title: Episode 033: Life on Edge
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: If you're a Rails junkie, you'll want to develop on Edge Rails. Matt Clark explains how to get started and shares some of the challenges of working on Edge.
item.description: If you're a Rails junkie, you'll want to develop on Edge Rails. Matt Clark explains how to get started and shares some of the challenges of working on Edge.

item.title: Episode 032: Capistrano
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Rob Kaufman takes on Capistrano 2. What is it? How does it work? What's changed since version 1?
item.description: Rob Kaufman takes on Capistrano 2. What is it? How does it work? What's changed since version 1?

item.title: Episode 031: Seaside
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Roger Whitney explores Seaside, the web application framework based on Smalltalk.
item.description: Roger Whitney explores Seaside, the web application framework based on Smalltalk.

item.title: Episode 030: Tuneshelf
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Dominic Damian talks about his experiences building Tuneshelf, a web application that allows music fans to keep track of their favorite music albums.
item.description: Dominic Damian talks about his experiences building Tuneshelf, a web application that allows music fans to keep track of their favorite music albums.

item.title: Episode 029: Big Stinking Piles (of data)
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: What do you do when third-party data vendors don't speak REST? Rob Kaufman discuss real-world techniques for importing and exporting data. (This talk was also given at RailsConf 2007.)
item.description: What do you do when third-party data vendors don't speak REST? Rob Kaufman discuss real-world techniques for importing and exporting data. (This talk was also given at RailsConf 2007.)

item.title: Episode 028: Simple Sidebar Plugin
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Ryan Felton shows how to use Simple Sidebar plugin to DRY up sidebar content in applications.
item.description: Ryan Felton shows how to use Simple Sidebar plugin to DRY up sidebar content in applications.

item.title: Episode 027: Headliner and Styler
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley talks about his newest plugins: Headliner and Styler.
item.description: Patrick Crowley talks about his newest plugins: Headliner and Styler.

item.title: Episode 026: ActsAsSolr
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Rob Kaufman shows how easy it is to integrate Solr powered search into your Rails application using the ActsAsSolr plugin.
item.description: Rob Kaufman shows how easy it is to integrate Solr powered search into your Rails application using the ActsAsSolr plugin.

item.title: Episode 025: Ajax CSS Star Rating with ActsAsRateable
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Ryan Felton shows off how to build an Ajax-powered, CSS star rater using the ActsAsRateable plugin and Komodo Media's CSS Star Rating Redux technique.
item.description: Ryan Felton shows off how to build an Ajax-powered, CSS star rater using the ActsAsRateable plugin and Komodo Media's CSS Star Rating Redux technique.

item.title: Episode 024: Using Ruby + Amazon SQS to build backdoors
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Brian Chapados talks about using Ruby and Amazon's Simple Que Service web service to build backdoors into systems.
item.description: Brian Chapados talks about using Ruby and Amazon's Simple Que Service web service to build backdoors into systems.

item.title: Episode 023: RubyInline
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Nick Zadrozny shows us how to use C in Ruby with RubyInline. As an example, Nick walks us through writing a password-generating application with the help of Diceware.
item.description: Nick Zadrozny shows us how to use C in Ruby with RubyInline. As an example, Nick walks us through writing a password-generating application with the help of Diceware.

item.title: Episode 022: DRP
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: DRP stands for Directed Ruby Programming. In this episode, Warren Henning explains exactly what that means and why you might be interested in it.
item.description: DRP stands for Directed Ruby Programming. In this episode, Warren Henning explains exactly what that means and why you might be interested in it.

item.title: Episode 021: Merb
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Chris Van Pelt gives us an introduction to Merb. Merb is a Ruby framework built by Ezra Zygmuntowicz.
item.description: Chris Van Pelt gives us an introduction to Merb. Merb is a Ruby framework built by Ezra Zygmuntowicz.

item.title: Episode 020: ImageScience
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Tom Werner covers some of the basics of the ruby image library ImageScience. ImageScience is a wrapper for the FreeImage graphics library, and is a lightweight alternative to RMagick.
item.description: In this episode, Tom Werner covers some of the basics of the ruby image library ImageScience. ImageScience is a wrapper for the FreeImage graphics library, and is a lightweight alternative to RMagick.

item.title: Episode 019: AWS S3
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Jordan Fowler gives a presentation on Amazon's S3 service. He also covers the AWS::S3 gem written by Marcel Molina Jr.
item.description: Jordan Fowler gives a presentation on Amazon's S3 service. He also covers the AWS::S3 gem written by Marcel Molina Jr.

item.title: Episode 018: StaffTool
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Toby Sterrett gives us an update on his soon-to-be-released project StaffTool. StaffTool is a web-based church management application build with Ruby on Rails.
item.description: In this episode, Toby Sterrett gives us an update on his soon-to-be-released project StaffTool. StaffTool is a web-based church management application build with Ruby on Rails.

item.title: Episode 017: ActsNaked
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: In today's episode, Patrick Crowley introduces his first Rails plugin titled ActsNaked. It's an easy way to strip your models and keep them DRY.
item.description: In today's episode, Patrick Crowley introduces his first Rails plugin titled ActsNaked. It's an easy way to strip your models and keep them DRY.

item.title: Episode 016: MasterView Templates
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Deb Lewis showcases her project MasterView. MasterView is a template language for Rails.
item.description: Deb Lewis showcases her project MasterView. MasterView is a template language for Rails.

item.title: Episode 015: Rails for Legacy Applications
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley covers some of the finer point of using Rails with legacy applications.
item.description: Patrick Crowley covers some of the finer point of using Rails with legacy applications.

item.title: Episode 014: Ruby Idioms - Part 1
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Tom Werner gives us part 1 of his series on Ruby idoms.
item.description: Tom Werner gives us part 1 of his series on Ruby idoms.

item.title: Episode 013: Mocha and Stubba
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Kevin Clark shows us how to use mocks and stubs in your Ruby tests using Mocha and Stubba
item.description: Kevin Clark shows us how to use mocks and stubs in your Ruby tests using Mocha and Stubba

item.title: Episode 012: Deployment
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Dominic Damian talks about the different options available to you when deploying a Rails application. He covers areas such as servers, caching, database, and hosting.
item.description: Dominic Damian talks about the different options available to you when deploying a Rails application. He covers areas such as servers, caching, database, and hosting.

item.title: Episode 011: ActsAsTaggable Plugin
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley discusses his experiences with actsastaggable. He starts off outlining some of the differences between the gem and the plugin. Patrick then creates a simple app to show off some of the capabilities of the plugin.
item.description: Patrick Crowley discusses his experiences with actsastaggable. He starts off outlining some of the differences between the gem and the plugin. Patrick then creates a simple app to show off some of the capabilities of the plugin.

item.title: Episode 010: REST Web Services with Rails
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Chris Abad talks a little bit about providing web services to your Rails application using some of the new REST features found in Edge Rails. At the end, he also throws in a bonus tip on using Rick Olson's authentication plugin restful_authentication to add authentication to your REST API.
item.description: Chris Abad talks a little bit about providing web services to your Rails application using some of the new REST features found in Edge Rails. At the end, he also throws in a bonus tip on using Rick Olson's authentication plugin restful_authentication to add authentication to your REST API.

item.title: Episode 009: REST with Rails
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Kevin Clark shows us some of the new REST features found in Edge Rails. He covers some basic concepts such as HTTP verbs, and also takes a look at using RESTful routes.
item.description: In this episode, Kevin Clark shows us some of the new REST features found in Edge Rails. He covers some basic concepts such as HTTP verbs, and also takes a look at using RESTful routes.

item.title: Episode 008: Chronic
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Tom Werner has released the ruby gem Chronic, a natural language date and time parser. In this episode he gives us a quick run through of some of the cool points.
item.description: Tom Werner has released the ruby gem Chronic, a natural language date and time parser. In this episode he gives us a quick run through of some of the cool points.

item.title: Episode 007: Rails Authentication
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Kevin Clark gives us a brief overview of two of Rick Olson's authentication plugins: actsasauthenticated and restful_authentication.
item.description: Kevin Clark gives us a brief overview of two of Rick Olson's authentication plugins: actsasauthenticated and restful_authentication.

item.title: Episode 006: Dynamic Domains
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Chris Abad introduces the new web service, Outlandish. He also shows us how they handle dynamic domains within Outlandish.
item.description: Chris Abad introduces the new web service, Outlandish. He also shows us how they handle dynamic domains within Outlandish.

item.title: Episode 005: ARTS Plugin
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Kevin Clark demos his new Rails plugin, ARTS, which allows you to test your RJS templates.
item.description: Kevin Clark demos his new Rails plugin, ARTS, which allows you to test your RJS templates.

item.title: Episode 004: Numbers
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Tom Werner wows us with the power of numbers in Ruby.
item.description: Tom Werner wows us with the power of numbers in Ruby.

item.title: Episode 003: mkmf
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Kevin Clark takes us through some of the work he's doing on mkmf for his Google Summer of Code project. We also get a quick preview of Kevin's RailsDay app, Advisr.
item.description: Kevin Clark takes us through some of the work he's doing on mkmf for his Google Summer of Code project. We also get a quick preview of Kevin's RailsDay app, Advisr.

item.title: Episode 002: Camping
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Chris Van Pelt discussing Camping, a microframework built by Why the Lucky Stiff. Chris also gives us a preview of a cool little Camping app he built title Croppr.
item.description: Chris Van Pelt discussing Camping, a microframework built by Why the Lucky Stiff. Chris also gives us a preview of a cool little Camping app he built title Croppr.

item.title: Episode 001: Summer of Rails
item.itunes:keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, programming, web, development, agile, railscast
item.itunes:summary: Patrick Crowley discusses Summer of Rails. He also introduces his first Summer of Rails project, Graffletopia.
item.description: Patrick Crowley discusses Summer of Rails. He also introduces his first Summer of Rails project, Graffletopia.
